page.title: 01INTRO,SOUTH-EAST IPSWICH.
page.content: This sector contains a great variety of landscape and land-use,it is both urban and rural,it has obvious links with it's estuary location and is an area under-going great change. If one thing dominates, it is the estuary of the River Orwell, dissecting the area from North to South. In the 1980's more people have a chance to view this spectacular scenery with the construction of the Orwell Bridge.This architectural wonder gives views to the North of Dockland industry and extensive housing,to the South of farmland,sheltered water for yachts and peaceful woodland. Urban sprawl,old industry alongside modern industry,changes in river traffic and a radical change in the road network,all provide issues which make this area interesting and worthy of futher investigation.
